alert.note: Alert for East Puget Sound Lowlands; Hood Canal Area; Southwest Interior; Tacoma Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued August 13 at 4:26AM PDT until August 17 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 AM PDT MONDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, Hot conditions with daytime temperatures in the low to mid 90s and lows in the 60s. This will pose moderate to major HeatRisk levels and a risk of heat- related illness. For the Excessive Heat Watch, Dangerously hot conditions with daytime temperatures in the mid to upper 90s and lows in the 60s are possible. This will pose a more widesspread threat of major HeatRisk levels for heat-related illness. * WHERE...Southwest Interior, Tacoma Area, Hood Canal Area and East Puget Sound Lowlands. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, from 11 AM this morning to 5 AM PDT Monday. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from late tonight through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Major Heat Risk level poses a major risk for heat- related illnesses for anyone without effective cooling or adequate hydration.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.

area.areaDesc: East Puget Sound Lowlands; Hood Canal Area; Southwest Interior; Tacoma Area
